rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will be a word in the dictionary that comes not too far after the word "effect".)

clues.text: To expel, like an ump sometimes does to an MLB manager
The pile of assets that allows a college to keep operating
The belief in the equality of all people
It means vivacious or giving off bubbles
9-letter description of a flagrantly offensive error or omission

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will be two words, one of them having an "E" more than the previous word.)

clues.text: A word meaning great delight is happy to add an E to be a young 'roo
A word denoting vigor doubles its E to make the cry of a young bird
A word meaning angry takes on an E to enjoy a honey & water alcoholic concoction
To experience again in your mind becomes a word meaning to ease pain
A unit of fluid capacity takes on an E to become a 16th century sailing vessel

Despite all his scheming on "Looney Tunes" , Wile E. Coyote never quite catches this prey
These neighbors of the Flintstones had a son named Bamm-Bamm
"Double Indecency" & "Skytanic" are episodes of the show about this title spy whose codename is "Duchess"

ANKLE TASTER

HATES PAN

HI CORONERS!

EVIDENT WHO WE DIG

PLATE ONE!

It doesn't get much closer than the 2009 Wimbledon final, where this Swiss Mr. beat Andy Roddick 16-14 in the fifth set
In 2015, after 8:08:32, just 8 seconds would separate the 1st & 3rd place finishers in this type of race
Russian empress who covers 95,000 square miles of water as a North American quintet
Central Florida NBA team used by Prince Husain in "One Thousand & One Nights"
Symbol on the Israeli flag that sang "Let's Dance"

The University of Texas at Austin uses this gesture, also a slogan
Some schools have advocated replacing clapping with this Fosse-esque gesture, which is sign language for applause
The pinkie & thumb extend & the other fingers curl to form a Hawaiian gesture for this 2-word phrase about relaxing, aka shaka

An old system used to weigh precious stones & metals is called this, like an ancient city where the Greeks horsed around
Throw weight is the maximum payload of this, the "M" in ICBM
This boxing class just below heavyweight includes the name of a warship class just below battleship
This name for a type of pound is from the French for "goods of weight"

In 1814 the British offered him $30,000 & a captaincy in the Royal Navy if he'd join them; he didn't say oui but turned on them
